messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Bob R - Studies in Kyo Goto
messages.msgSnippet: Jim, Bob, and all, Since my name was mentioned, I d better respond! For anyone that doesn t know me - perhaps many of you since I m usually pretty quiet on all
messages.messageBody:
Jim, Bob, and all,

Since my name was mentioned, I'd better respond! For anyone that doesn't
know me - perhaps many of you since I'm usually pretty quiet on all the
lists I've been on since Robert Cole's first - I am a notorious
bibliomaniac, among other obsessions, mostly tsuba these days.

Unfortunately I don't know any special terminology for these
boxes-within-boxes except "slipcover" and "shipping box." When I do get
books that have the shipping box part (still on used or on new books) I
archive them in the attic since they tend to look shoddy on my shelves. It's
a very Asian thing, although I have seen them on high-end European art
books. Is Alan Bale on board here yet? He's the real pro on books.

For anyone who hasn't drifted off to sleep through this, what originally
came to my mind was "chitsu," which is the name of the very Japanese folding
book cover with little ivory (or plastic) tabs that slip into little pockets
on the spine. Love those.

Of course I can't spot my copy of "Studies in Kyo Goto" at the moment, wish
they had put the English on the spine, too. But I did find my copy of "Tsuba
no Bi" that was discussed on the other list recently. In fact, I'm pretty
sure I have *two* copies of that.

Bibliomania - a perplexing and tragic affliction.

Craig Harris

PS - Thanks Jim for giving us a sane refuge.


----- Original Message -----
From: "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, April 23, 2003 7:22 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Bob R - Studies in Kyo Goto


> Bob,
> No ISBN number, but the name appears in English and Japanese on the front
> cover of the book, but not on the spine. It doesn't appear in English on
> the thin board dust cover, but the name is in English on both the spine
and
> the front of the thicker two-piece outer cardboard box. (I don't know the
> proper terms for these boxes, I'm sure Craig would know.) It shouldn't be
> hard to spot. I'd guess that you could get it at Isshindo:
> http://www.book-kanda.or.jp/kosyo/1013/index.asp
>
> Jim
>
>
> > Just to let everyone know that doesn't already. As Ron
> > pointed out I do find books (and anything else LEGAL)
> > over here in Japan for folks that ask. Sometimes I can
> > find them very easily other times it takes me some
> > time to locate them throughout Japan and have them
> > shipped to me to send out. It has been a while since I
> > updated my site and for that I appologize. But to find
> > items or books any information you can get me such as
> > ISBN Number is extremely helpful so is a picture of
> > the cover as I am SLOWLY learning to read Japanese.
> >
> > Bob R
> >
> > =====
> > Check out "Cowboy" Bob's Books & Things at:
> > http://asia.geocities.com/gentleman9/index.html
> >

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Bob R - Studies in Kyo Goto
messages.msgSnippet: Bob, No ISBN number, but the name appears in English and Japanese on the front cover of the book, but not on the spine.  It doesn t appear in English on the
messages.messageBody:
Bob,
No ISBN number, but the name appears in English and Japanese on the front
cover of the book, but not on the spine. It doesn't appear in English on
the thin board dust cover, but the name is in English on both the spine and
the front of the thicker two-piece outer cardboard box. (I don't know the
proper terms for these boxes, I'm sure Craig would know.) It shouldn't be
hard to spot. I'd guess that you could get it at Isshindo:
http://www.book-kanda.or.jp/kosyo/1013/index.asp

Jim


> Just to let everyone know that doesn't already. As Ron
> pointed out I do find books (and anything else LEGAL)
> over here in Japan for folks that ask. Sometimes I can
> find them very easily other times it takes me some
> time to locate them throughout Japan and have them
> shipped to me to send out. It has been a while since I
> updated my site and for that I appologize. But to find
> items or books any information you can get me such as
> ISBN Number is extremely helpful so is a picture of
> the cover as I am SLOWLY learning to read Japanese.
>
> Bob R
>
> =====
> Check out "Cowboy" Bob's Books & Things at:
> http://asia.geocities.com/gentleman9/index.html
>
>
